name: Fish Molee
history: Fish Molee, also known as Meen Moilee, is a Kerala-style fish stew. It's a part of Kerala's rich coastal cuisine and is known for its mild yet flavorful coconut milk-based gravy.
description: Fish Molee is a delicately flavored fish curry, cooked in a mildly spiced coconut milk sauce with hints of turmeric and green chilies. It's usually made with firm white fish and is both nourishing and comforting.

ingredients.item: firm white fish (like cod or halibut), cut into pieces

instructions.title: SautÃ© Onions and Spices
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pan. Add mustard seeds and let them splutter. Add onions, ginger, garlic, green chilies, and curry leaves. SautÃ© until onions are translucent.

instructions.title: Add Turmeric and Tomatoes
instructions.description: Stir in turmeric powder. Add tomatoes and cook until they are soft.

instructions.title: Simmer with Coconut Milk
instructions.description: Pour in the coconut milk and bring to a gentle simmer. Do not boil.

instructions.title: Cook the Fish
instructions.description: Add the fish pieces and salt. Cover and simmer on low heat until the fish is cooked through.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve hot with rice or appams (rice pancakes).

tips: Use fresh, firm-fleshed fish for the best texture.
Keep the heat low while cooking with coconut milk to prevent it from splitting.
variations: Add a pinch of fenugreek powder for an extra layer of flavor.
Include vegetables like bell peppers or green peas for more nutrition.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat gently to avoid breaking the fish.
presentationTips: Serve in a traditional clay pot for an authentic presentation.
Accompany with a side of lemon wedges.
